intro: Petunga pentamera, commonly known as the five-petaled petunga, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with five petals, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in moist, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
